segments.text: I watch the water spill over the edge of the sink, and it’s almost hypnotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on that plate, like it’s the only thing that matters right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy balancing on that stool, and my heart races just looking at him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s face is so hopeful, like she’s waiting for a miracle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the whole scene is ridiculous—water everywhere, kids stealing cookies, and no one notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside is so bright and cheerful, like a lie compared to the mess inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse, and I can’t look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like laughing at how absurd this all is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just going to ruin everything, and no one cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get in so much trouble if they’re caught.
segments.speaker: PAR
